awards.description: DESCRIPTION:THIS PROJECT WILL ASSIST THE SELDOVIA VILLAGE TRIBE IN BUILDING CAPACITIES AND DEVELOPING PROGRAMS TO PROTECT THE TRIBAL ENVIRONMENT AND HEALTH.  OBJECTIVES/WORKPLAN COMPONENTS INCLUDE: 1. BUILDING ADMINISTRATIVE CAPACITY; 2. BUILDING PROGRAMMATIC CAPACITY; 3) BUILDING COMMUNICATIONS CAPACITY; AND 4) BUILDING TECHNICAL CAPACITY.ACTIVITIES:WORKPLAN ACTIVITIES/TASKS INCLUDE: MAINTAINING AN ENVIRONMENTAL OFFICE AND ADMINISTRATIVE AND PROGRAM MANAGEMENT FUNCTIONS; ATTENDING TRAINING AND RESEARCHING ISSUES AND RESOURCES; COMMUNICATING INTERNALLY AND EXTERNALLY ABOUT ISSUES AND CONDUCTING COMMUNITY EDUCATION ACTIVITIES; BUILDING TECHNICAL KNOWLEDGE OF AIR AND WATER QUALITY; DEVELOPING AN ENVIRONMENTAL INVENTORY; DEVELOPING AN INDOOR AIR QUALITY MONITORING PROGRAM; AND COLLECTING BASELINE OCEAN WATER QUALITY DATA.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROJECT ARE THE SELDOVIA VILLAGE TRIBE, TRIBAL MEMBERS, AND THE LOCAL PUBLIC.  THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES OF THIS PROJECT INCLUDE: INCREASING TRIBAL ADMINISTRATIVE CAPACITY TO RESPOND TO LOCAL ENVIRONMENTAL CONCERNS; INCREASING TRIBAL PROGRAMMATIC CAPACITY TO ASSESS LOCAL ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES; INCREASING COMMUNITY KNOWLEDGE OF ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES AND ACTIONS PROTECTIVE OF THE ENVIRONMENT; AND INCREASING TRIBAL TECHNICAL CAPACITIES TO PRIORITIZE ENVIRONMENTAL NEEDS AND DEVELOP PROGRAMS TO ADDRESS THEM.  ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE: PERFORMANCE REPORTS; FINANCIAL REPORTS; COPIES OF OUTREACH MATERIALS; EVENT SUMMARY REPORTS; AN UPDATED ENVIRONMENTAL INVENTORY REPORT; AND A BASELINE INDOOR AIR QUALITY REPORT.
DIST. FOR CRRSA HIGHWAY INFRASTRUCTURE PROGRAM FUNDING. ELIGIBLE ACTIVITIES INCLUDE THOSE ACTIVITIES THAT ARE ALSO ELIGIBLE UNDER THE TRIBAL TRANSPORTATION PROGRAM AS DESCRIBED IN 23 USC 202.
SELF GOVERNANCE COMPACTS (TPA BASE) CR1 (17.53%) DISTRIBUTION
SELF GOVERNANCE COMPACTS FY 21 CR1 (19.73%) TPA BASE DIST.

DISTS. FOR ADDITIONAL AND FINAL TRIBAL TRANSPORTATION PROGRAM AND TRIBAL TRANSPORTATION PLANNING FOR ACTIVITIES AND PROJECTS DESCRIBED IN 23 USC 202(A)(1) AND A FHWA APPROVED TRANSPORTATION IMPROVEMENT PROGRAM (TIP).

awards.awarding_agency: Department of Housing and Urban Development
Department of Housing and Urban Development
